div.head: Plates
div.p:
śrī| vijayatāM mahārājaḥ| Āyur ārogyam aiśvaryyañ cābhivarddhaṁtāM| Iṣṭa-sampad astuūttūarottarāḥ kriyās sa
mpadyantāM| śrīmad-asanapurādhiṣṭhānua-vāsiī śrīmad-bhagavat-svāmi-māahāsena-pādānudhyātā
nāṁ tribhuvana-mātrir̥bhir abhiraksitānāṁ maānavya-sanagotrāṇāṁ hārītī-putrāṇāṁ koauśikī
-vara-prasāda-labdha-rājyānāM catur-udadhi-paryyantaḥ-prathita-yaśasaāM Aśvameddha
-yājināM caḷukyānām anvayam unnamayitumaM sakrarddanasaṅkrandana-bhūta-raṇarāgasya
praṇaptāḥ Asahya-vikramasya vipula-kīrtteḥ kīrttivarmmaṇaḥ prapautraḥ śakti-traya-vaśikrir̥ta3-saka
la-mahī-maṇḍalasya satyaāśraya-prir̥hiviī-vallabha-mahārājādhirāja-parameśvara-bhaṭṭārakasya priyānu
jasya svāsidhārā-namita-samasta-sāmanta-maṇḍalasya sthala-jalādi-durgga-viṣameṣv a
pi labdha-vijayatā prathita-jana-prasnuta-kāmadhenoḥ lokātiśayita-vikramatayā naraloka
-vikramasya viṣṇuvarddhana-mahārājasya priya-tanayasyāneka-samara-saṁghaṭṭa-labdha-vijaya-śīla
tā-prasūta-yaśaḥ-prasūtāmoda-gandhādhivāsita-sakala-dig-maṇḍalasya nānā-śaāstrā
bhyāsopabr̥ṁhita-niśita-vimala-buddheḥ tyāgaudāryya-gāṁbhīryya-dhairyya-kānti-pra
jñādi-guṇa-gaṇālaṁkr̥tasya trailokya-vikramoddyodtita-sakala-lokāśraya-bhuja-yu
gaḷa-bala-namitāśeṣa-ripu-nr̥pati-vara-makuṭa-taṭa-ghaṭitāneka-maṇi-kiraṇa-rāga-rañji
ta-caraṇāravinda-yugaḷasya viīra-dhvajopātta-śakrarddhi-visparddhita-vibhūter anekāhi
ta-nara-vara-śiraḥ-karoṭikā-vitāna-vikhyāta-yaśaso deva-dvija-guru-yatadhiyaty-atithi-śiṣṭeṣṭā
nujiīvi-saṁbandhibhir anavarata-prakāmopabhoga-bhujyamāna-vividha-puṇya-phala-saṁpuū
rṇṇāmr̥ta-dhenoḥ śrī-jayasiṁgha-vallabha-mahārājasya priyānujasya tyā
ga-dhenuḥ śakti-traya-saṁpannāneka-vidyā-viśāradaḥ ripu-maṇḍaleṣv api vigraha-siddhiḥ siṁha
-vikrama-nayopetatvāT rāja-lokāśraya śrīmad-indravarmma-mahārajasya putraḥ
nānā-śaāstrābhyāsopāttāneka-vidyā-viśāradaḥ viṣṇuvarddhana-mahārājasyamahārājena paḷḷi-rāṣṭre koṇeki
-nāma grāmaḥ saṁpradattaḥ| @@@grāmeyakān rājapuruṣa-taḷavara-daṇḍa-nāyaka-rāṣṭrika-dhūta-bhaṭa-naṭa-ceṭaka-paricāraka-niyuktādhyakṣa-praśāstr̥-samāhartr̥-(nā)nāyakāṁś cājñapayati1051[+|] śrotriyasya sakala-dig-anta-prathita-yaśaso yajana-yājanādhyayanādhyāpana-dāna-pratigraha1052-niyama-niratasya sarvvāgama-viśeṣa-pratipādanatvād
Face IVa. adyakāla-vararucir iti vikhyātasya mahāsenaśarmma[ṇaḥ] putrāya viduśa[r*]mmaṇe1053 brāhmaṇa-sūtra-mantra-tantropaniṣa[t*]-prabhr̥ty-aneka1054-vidyā-viduṣe parāśara-gotrāya1055 sarvva-sat[*]tvānukaṁpita-maitrī1056-ci(r)ttāya taittirīyaka1057-cara[ṇā]ya āpastamba-sūtrāya kandeṟuboya-brāhmaṇāya1058 ātukuru-vāstavyāya1059 māgha-māse soma(g)grahaṇa-kā[le] asmad-āyur-bala-vijaya-bhogaiśvaryyāvr̥ddhaye1060 sampradatta devabhoga-hala-varjja[+|]
Face IVb. mamānvayajā ye kecid anāgate kāle bhūmipā[lā][ḥ*] sarvve grāma-sa[ṁ*]rakṣaṇaṁ kurvvantu grāma-saṁbhavādhikr̥tā[ḥ*] sarvve ayyaṇ-anvayajā dhanañjaya-prabhr̥tayas tat-puruṣāś1061 ca[+|] etasya grāmasya1062 śottara-śate[ṣv1063 aṁ]śeṣu viṣṇuśarmmaṇe viṁṣati[ḥ*] aṁśakāḥ1064[+|] tasya sūnave1065 m[ā]diśarmmaṇe viṁśati[ḥ*][+|] mahāsenaśarmmaṇe viṁśati[ḥ*][+|] tasya ca priy[ā]nujāya1066 dāmaśarmaṇe viṁśati[ḥ*][+|]
Face Va. mudokuraboyāya1067 gaṇaiśarmmaṇe1068 ṣaṭ[+|] [ā]tukuruboyāya1069 viṣṇuśarmmaṇe pañca[+|] koṇḍasāmiboyāya1070 pañca[+|] pāṭiboyāyaika1071[+|] kumunūruboyāya1072 mādiśarmmaṇe1073 catvāraḥ1074 * * * i1075-boyāya1076 dvau1077[+|] naḍukuṟiboyāya1078 sarvvaśarmmaṇe dvau[+|] veḷu[caḷiboya]-pe[ṭṭa]śarmmaṇe1079 dvau[+|] re * * * boyāya1080 dvau[+|] kanpaṟboyāya1081 maṇḍaśarmma[ṇe] dvau[+|] revaśarmma[ṇe] dvau[+|] irukuṭūru(r)boyāya1082 dvau[+|] yo [+’]smac1083-chāsanaṁ atikramya[ti*]1084 sa pāpaḥ1085 śārīraṁ daṇḍam arhati[+||]
Face Vb. bhūmidānā[t paran dā] [na*]n na bhūtan na bhaviṣyati[+|] [tasyāpa]-haraṇāt pāpan na bhūtan na bhaviṣyati[+||] (1) sva-dattāṁ para-dattāṁ vā yo hareta1086 vasundharām1087[+|] [gavāṁ śata-saha][srāṇāṁ ha*][ntu][ḥ*] pibati kilbiṣam1088[+||](2) ba[hu]bhi[r*] vasudhā dattā bahubhiś cānupāli[tā][+|] [ya]sya yasya ya[dā bhū]mi[s*] tasya tasya tathā phalam1089[+||](3) śrī-jayasiṁgha(ha)-vallabhamahārājasya pravarddhamāna-vija[ya*]-rājya-sa[ṁ*]va[t*]sare triṁśatitama-varṣe1090 āśvayuje māse śuklapakṣe da[śa]mī-divase śravaṇa-candravāre gaṁgavijaya-varddhaki-likhitam idaṁ śāsa[nam]1091[+|] svasti[+|]

app.note: My scan is poor and it is not clear from Narasimhaswami's notation whether he supplies sya as illegible or as omitted in the original. I think I can recognise Ā after the vestiges belonging to ja, but if yu was quite narrow, then it is possible that sya was in fact also engraved. I also see no trace of r (nor of i) in the second character and believe that his r is a restoration rather than something he could discern in the plate. Assuming that I am correct about these, I prefer to emend and parse as above, but an autopsy may rule this out and confirm Narasimhaswami's reading.
Narasimhaswami notes that something was added below da and then struck out.
As Narasimhaswami notes, it seems that the marker for ū was accidentally added to tta, possibly instead of correcting stu to stū.
Narasimhaswami emends to praṇaptuḥ and in a note corrects the sense to naptuḥ. It is not clear to me who is described here. @return to this?

Narasimhaswami corrects to -vijayasya. I believe the intent was rather -vijayatvād viṣamasiddheḥ (compare l4 of the Cīpurupalle plates and l8 of the Timmapuram plates), and wonder if a faint subscript v is perhaps actually present in the character read as tā.
The reading is clear even in my poor scan, but I wonder if something else had been intended by the composer, such as praśrita-, prārthi- or arthi-.

I accept Narasimhaswami's emendation for want of a better idea, but I am not sure this was the intent of the composer. There is also a pair of small dots, one below the other, on the right of kra above the headline, and another pair of fainter dots on the left of kra below the headline. These may be random damage, but it also seems possible that they are editorial marks.

The visarga is quite widely spaced on both sides, and there is a seemingly deliberate stroke between the visarga and the following ka, roughly oval with some additional strokes on the top, slightly resembling an archaic ma with very short arms. Possibly a jihvāmūlīya used in addition to the visarga and affixed to the left of ka instead of on top because this is the first line on the page, with a very narrow top margin.
Narasimhaswami's emendation is ingenuous and very plausible but may not be the only possible correction.

Narasimhaswami emends the nominatives to genitives and compounds lokāśraya to the following name. By my perception the composer had a more lax attitude to phrase/compound formation, which permitted these nominatives (among which he probably meant to include lokāśraya) to stand in apposition to the name in the genitive.Compare the other string of apparent nominatives in apposition to a genitive, starting in line 20.

Narasimhaswami also notes that what he reads as a final m was evidently intended for t. Though it looks rather like a small Brāhmī ma at headline height, I think it is in fact a final T, since this is not the usual form of final M in related records. I rather believe it is a reduced ta with a curled body, and what looks like the right arm of the ma-shape is either damage or, less likely, part of a headmark. Moreover, it was probably been added subsequently between tvā and the following rā, which may be part of the reason why it is not very clearly formed.

Narasimhaswami construes mahārājaḥ as the subject of ājñapayati (line 24) and emends the text accordingly. I prefer to assume that the adjectives in stem/nominative form were meant to be in apposition to the genitive, which in turn was used in place of an instrumental; compare the similar string starting in line 19 above. The visarga at the end of saṁpradattaḥ implies the end of a sentence here; the subject of the next sentence is in my perception to be understood to be the same king, but is not explicitly mentioned.
I accept the reading of Narasimhaswami, who marks the syllable ki as unclear.The consonant k is clear, and in my scanned estampage no trace of i is discernible.
